'''20w06a''' (labeled as '''Snapshot 20w06a''' in-game) is the first [[snapshot]] for [[Java Edition 1.16]], released on February 5, 2020,<ref name="20w06a">{{snap|20w06a|February 5, 2020}}</ref> which adds several new [[Nether Update]] features, like new biomes, the {{command|/locatebiome}} command, and fixes some bugs. This is the first snapshot released in 2020.

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Ancient Debris JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Ancient Debris]]'''
* Can be found throughout [[the Nether]] at any altitude, though it is much more common at lower levels.
* Can be refined into a [[netherite scrap]] by smelting in a [[furnace]] or [[blast furnace]].
* Same [[blast resistance]] as [[obsidian]].
* As an item, it floats on [[lava]].
* Cannot burn in lava or [[fire]].
* A [[diamond pickaxe]] or better is required to mine it.
* Always spawns covered by lava or blocks on all sides.

'''[[File:Basalt (UD) JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Basalt]]'''
* Makes up [[basalt pillar]]s.
* Generates in [[soul sand valley]]s.
* Can be placed directionally, similarly to [[log]]s.

'''[[File:Block of Netherite JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Block of Netherite]]'''
* Can be crafted with 9 [[netherite ingot]]s.
* A decorative block.
* As an item, it floats on lava.
* Cannot burn in lava or fire.
* Same blast resistance as obsidian, but is movable with [[piston]]s.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Fungus JE1 BE1.png; Warped Fungus JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Nether Fungus|Crimson and Warped Fungi]]'''
* Generate in [[Crimson Forest|crimson]] and [[warped forest]]s, respectively.
* Can be placed on [[dirt]], [[coarse dirt]], [[farmland]], [[podzol]], [[nylium]], [[soul soil]], and [[grass block]]s.
* [[Bone meal]] can be used on fungi to grow it into the respective [[huge fungi]] when placed on nylium.
* Unlike [[mushroom]]s, fungi cannot spread.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Nylium JE1 BE1.png; Warped Nylium JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Nylium|Crimson and Warped Nylium]]'''
* Resemble [[grass block]]s.
* Can be spread to [[netherrack]] by using bonemeal on a netherrack block next to a nylium block.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Planks JE1 BE1.png; Warped Planks JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Planks|Crimson and Warped Planks]]'''
* Don't burn.
* Crafted from the respective stem.
* Can be used to craft respective [[slab]]s, [[stairs]], [[fence]]s, [[fence gate]]s, [[pressure plate]]s, [[button]]s, [[door]]s, and [[trapdoor]]s.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Roots JE1 BE1.png; Warped Roots JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Crimson Roots|Crimson]] and [[Warped Roots]]'''
* Foliage that generates in both crimson and warped forest biomes, as well as [[soul sand valley]]s.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Sign (0).png; Warped Sign (0).png|32px}} [[Sign|Crimson and Warped Signs]]'''
* Work like normal wooden signs.
* Cannot be crafted in this snapshot.
* Unobtainable in [[Survival|Surviva]]<nowiki/>l mode.

'''{{Animate|Crimson Stem (UD) JE1.gif; Warped Stem (UD) JE1.gif|32px}} [[Log|Crimson and Warped Stems]]'''
* Comprise the trunks of [[huge fungi]].
* Have animated textures.
* Have a top texture similar to regular log blocks.
* Can be placed directionally, similarly to logs.
* Does not burn.
* Have respective stripped variants.

[[File:Nether Sprouts JE1 BE1.png|width=32x32]]''' [[Nether Sprouts]]'''
* Foliage that generates in warped forests.

'''[[File:Shroomlight JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Shroomlight]]'''
* Emits a light level of 15, similarly to [[glowstone]].
* Can be mined with any tool, but [[axe]]s are the most efficient.
* Generates as a part of huge fungi.

'''[[File:Soul Fire JE1.gif|32px]] [[Soul Fire]]'''
* Blue variant of [[fire]].
* Fire lit on [[soul soil]] turns into soul fire regardless of dimension.
** Burns forever, similar to regular fire on [[netherrack]] and [[magma block]]s.
* Generates naturally in the [[soul sand valley]] biome in [[the Nether]].
* Deals [[damage]] at a rate of {{hp|2}} per second as opposed to the {{hp|1}} per second of regular fire.
* Does not extinguish when in the [[rain]].<ref>{{bug|MC-171413}} resolved as "Works as Intended"</ref>

[[File:Soul Lantern JE1.png|width=32x32]]''' [[Soul Lantern|Soul Fire Lantern]]'''
* Gives off a light level of 10.
* Crafted similarly to a normal [[lantern]], using a [[soul fire torch]] instead of a normal torch.

'''[[File:Soul Torch.gif|32px]] [[Soul Torch|Soul Fire Torch]]'''
* Gives off a light level of 10.
* Crafted similarly to a normal torch, with [[soul soil]] being placed under the stick.

'''[[File:Soul Soil JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Soul Soil]]'''
* Generates in the [[soul sand valley]], alongside conventional [[soul sand]].
* Fire lit on soul soil is [[soul fire]].
* The [[player]] does not sink and is not slowed when walking on soul soil.

'''[[File:Warped Wart Block JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Warped Wart Block]]'''
* A variation of the [[nether wart block]].
* Generates as a part of huge warped fungi. Sometimes generates in the ground replacing the [[warped nylium]] in warped forest biome.

'''[[File:Weeping Vines Plant JE1.png|32px]] [[Weeping Vines]]'''
* Generates in the [[crimson forest]].
* Is placed on the bottom of a block and grows downward.

=== Items ===
'''[[File:Netherite Armor (Entity).png|32px]] [[Netherite Boots]], [[Netherite Chestplate|Chestplate]], [[Netherite Helmet|Helmet]] and [[Netherite Leggings|Leggings]]'''
* [[Crafted]] with a [[netherite ingot]] and the respective diamond item.
* Don't burn in [[lava]] or [[fire]] as items ''or'' when worn ([[player]]s equipping netherite armor, however, can still take [[fire damage]]).
* Float in lava.
* Grant one additional point of knockback resistance per item.
* Tougher than diamond armor.
* Have higher [[durability]] and [[enchantability]] than diamond.

'''{{Animate|Netherite Axe JE1.png; Netherite Hoe JE1.png; Netherite Pickaxe JE1.png; Netherite Shovel JE1.png; Netherite Sword JE1.png|32px}} [[Netherite Axe]], [[Netherite Hoe|Hoe]], [[Netherite Pickaxe|Pickaxe]], [[Netherite Shovel|Shovel]], and [[Netherite Sword|Sword]]'''
* Crafted with a netherite ingot and the respective diamond item.
* Float in lava.
* Cannot burn in lava or fire.
* Have higher durability, mining level, breaking multiplier, and enchantability than diamond.
* All items, except the hoe, deal 1 more [[damage]] than their diamond counterparts.

'''[[File:Netherite Ingot JE1 BE2.png|32px]] [[Netherite Ingot]]'''
* Crafted with 4 [[gold ingot]]s and 4 [[netherite scrap]]s.
* Can be used to upgrade diamond tools, swords, and armor.
* Floats in lava.
* Cannot burn in lava or fire.

[[File:Netherite Scrap JE1.png|width=32x32]]''' [[Netherite Scrap]]'''
* Obtained by smelting [[ancient debris]] in a [[furnace]].
* Used to create [[netherite ingot]]s.
* Floats in lava.
* Cannot burn in lava or fire.

'''[[Spawn egg]]s'''
* [[File:Zombie Pigman Spawn Egg JE2 BE1.png|width=32x32]] [[Hoglin spawn egg]]

=== Mobs ===
[[File:Hoglin JE1.png|64x64px]]''' [[Hoglin]]s'''
* Spawn in [[crimson forest]]s.
* Drop [[rotten flesh]].
* Currently have the same hitbox as [[pig]]s.
* Legs and ears flail wildly when moved or attacked.

=== World generation ===
'''[[Biome]]s'''
* {{BiomeLink|Crimson forest}}
** A dense forest with [[huge crimson fungi]]. [[Nether fungi]] are found in patches on the ground and [[weeping vines]] are found under the huge fungi.
** [[Zombie pigmen]] and hoglins may spawn here.
* {{BiomeLink|Soul sand valley}}
** A vast grotto composed of uncovered [[nether fossil]]s, [[soul sand]], [[soul soil]], large pillars made of [[basalt]], and [[soul fire]].
** [[Skeleton]]s, [[ghast]]s, and [[endermen]] may spawn here.
* {{BiomeLink|Warped forest}}
** A color variation of the [[crimson forest]], but with somewhat different vegetation, particles, and fog effects.
** Only [[endermen]] may spawn here.

'''[[Structures]]'''
* [[File:Nether fossil 1.png|32px]] [[Nether fossil]]s
** Generate in the [[soul sand valley]].
** They are different from the Overworld [[fossil]]s and generate random pieces of [[basalt]] instead of [[coal ore]].

'''[[Features]]'''
* [[File:Basalt Pillar.png|16px]] [[Basalt pillar]]
** Floor to ceiling pillars of [[basalt]] that generate in [[soul sand valley]]s.
* {{Animate|Huge Crimson fungi.png; Huge Warped fungi.png|x32px}} [[Huge fungus|Huge crimson and warped fungi]]
** New structure resembling trees found in crimson and warped forests, respectively.
** Made of crimson and warped stem blocks as well as red [[nether wart block]]s and warped wart blocks.
** Can be grown from their respective [[Nether fungi]].

=== Command format ===
'''{{cmd|locatebiome}}'''
* Used to locate specific [[biome]]s.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Sound]]s'''
* New sounds for most of the newly added blocks.{{more info|Table of block sounds with before and after}}

=== General ===
'''[[Particles (Java Edition)|Particles]]'''
* Added {{cd|ash|crimson_spore|soul_fire_flame|warped_spore|d=,}}.

'''[[Tag]]s'''
* Added block tag <code>fire</code>.
** Contains [[fire]] and [[soul fire]].
** Controls what blocks can burn [[entities]].
* Added block tag <code>nylium</code>.
** Contains [[crimson nylium]] and [[warped nylium]].
* Added <code>crimson_stems</code> block and item tags.
** Contains [[crimson stem]] and [[stripped crimson stem]].
* Added <code>warped_stems</code> block and item tags.
** Contains [[warped stem]] and [[stripped warped stem]].
* Added block tag <code>wart_blocks</code>.
** Contains [[nether wart block]] and [[warped wart block]].

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
[[File:Bamboo Shoot JE1 BE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Bamboo sapling|Bamboo Shoot]]'''
* Renamed from "Bamboo Saplings".

[[File:Bone Block (UD) JE2 BE2.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Bone Block|Bone Blocks]]'''
* Generate as part of [[nether fossil]]s in [[soul sand valley]]s.

[[File:Redstone Comparator (S) JE4.png|width=46x46]] '''[[Redstone Comparator|Redstone Comparators]]'''
* Changed the way to calculate the input signal.
** First, if there is an adjacent container behind, it detects the signal from the container. If not, it detects the signal from redstone components.
** Then, if it is not less than 15, the detected signal becomes the input signal. Otherwise, it also gets a signal from [[item frame]] and container behind separated by a redstone conductor block from the comparator, and take the maximum of the three as the input signal.

[[File:Flower Pot JE3.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Flower Pot|Flower Pots]]'''
* Has a bottom texture when empty.

{{Animate|Gravel JE5 BE4.png;Soul Sand JE2 BE2.png|32px}} '''[[Gravel]] and [[Soul Sand]]'''
* Generate in the new [[soul sand valley]] biomes.

[[File:Netherrack JE4 BE2.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Netherrack]]'''
* Using [[bone meal]] on [[netherrack]] adjacent to [[nylium]] converts it into nylium.
** If two nylium blocks of different types are present, it chooses the type at random based on how many blocks of each type are around it.

[[File:Nether Wart Block JE3.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Nether Wart Block|Nether Wart Blocks]]'''
* Texture changed from [[File:Nether Wart Block JE2 BE2.png|32px]].
* Generate as a part of huge crimson fungi. Sometimes generates in the ground replacing the [[crimson nylium]] in crimson forest biome.

{{Animate|2=32px|Piston (U) JE3.png;Sticky Piston (U) JE3.png}} '''[[Piston]]s and [[Sticky Piston|Sticky Pistons]]'''
* Hardness has been increased to 1.5.
* [[Pickaxe]]s are now more efficient on pistons.<ref>{{bug|MC-140544||Pickaxes don't speed up piston breaking}}</ref>
* Pistons can now support [[non-solid block]]s on its top face without them popping off when the piston retracts.<ref>{{bug|MC-93631||Pistons pop off blocks attached to their back when retracting}}</ref>

[[File:Inactive Redstone Wire (unconnected) JE2.png|width=64x64]] '''[[Redstone Dust]]'''
* Has a bottom texture.

[[File:Smooth Quartz Block JE3 BE2.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Smooth Quartz Block]]'''
* Renamed from "Smooth Quartz".

[[File:Cobblestone Wall (EWU) JE3.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Wall]]s'''
* Walls in the middle of a row longer have pillars when stacked vertically.
** [[Block state]] now uses {{cd|none|low|tall|d=and}} for {{cd|east|west|north|south|d=and}} directional values.

=== Items ===
[[File:Clay Ball JE2 BE2.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Clay Ball]]'''
* Renamed from "Clay".

=== Mobs ===
[[File:Enderman JE2.png|width=50x50]] '''[[Endermen]]'''
* Now spawn in [[soul sand valley]]s and warped forests.

[[File:Ghast JE2 BE2.gif|width=43x43]] '''[[Ghast]]s'''
* Sounds are now heard at a shorter range.
* Now spawn in soul sand valleys.

[[File:Skeleton JE6 BE4.png|width=50x50]] '''[[Skeleton]]s'''
* Now spawn in soul sand valleys.

[[File:Zombified Piglin JE5.png|width=50x50]] '''[[Zombified Piglin|Zombie Pigmen]]'''
* Now spawn in [[crimson forest]]s.
* No longer have sounds.

=== World generation ===
'''[[Biome]]s'''
* Biomes in [[the Nether]] may now differ based on altitude.

'''Ceiling'''
* Alongside mushrooms, huge crimson and warped fungi can generate over Y=128 in [[the Nether]].

'''[[Nether Wastes|Nether biome]]'''
* The old "Nether" biome is now called "Nether Wastes".

'''[[Structure]]s'''
* [[Shipwreck]]s and [[ocean ruin]]s are now less common.

=== Command format ===
'''General'''
* The message shown when running an unknown/incomplete command has changed.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Advancement]]s'''
* The description of the "Sky's the Limit" advancement has changed from "Find Elytra" to "Find elytra."

'''Knockback resistance'''
* Is now a scale of the amount of knockback taken instead of a probability to take no knockback.

'''[[Patrol]]s'''
* No longer spawn when the [[player]] is close to any intact [[village]].

'''[[Recipe book]]'''
* The [[cartography table]] recipe now unlocks with [[paper]] instead of [[string]].

'''[[Sound]]s'''
* Updated block sounds for [[bone block]]s, [[netherrack]], [[soul sand]], [[nether wart block]]s, [[nether bricks]] (and variants), and [[nether quartz ore]].

'''[[World Spawn|Spawn]]'''
* Players can reset their spawn point using a [[bed]] when [[monster]]s are near, although players still cannot sleep when mobs are near.

=== General ===
'''[[Debug menu]]'''
* When outside the world's vertical area, the debug menu no longer lists 'minecraft:the_void' as the biome.
** Instead, it simply hides the [[biome]] information.

'''[[Saved hotbar|Saved toolbars]]'''
* Renamed to "Saved Hotbars"

'''[[Options]]'''
* Renamed "Scale" to "Chat Text Size" in chat settings.

'''[[Materials]]'''
* Added new nether wood material.
** Uses the wood material color.<!--Don't add map colors, they aren't the same as the material color.-->
** Uses default properties.

'''Rendering'''
* Improved [[entity]] shadows to the ground.

'''[[Tag]]s'''
* Added crimson and warped wooden items to the {{cd|planks|standing_signs|wall_signs|wooden_buttons|wooden_doors|wooden_fences|wooden_pressure_plates|wooden_slabs|wooden_stairs|wooden_trapdoors|d=and}} block tags.
* Added crimson and warped wooden items to the {{cd|planks|signs|wooden_buttons|wooden_doors|wooden_fences|wooden_pressure_plates|wooden_slabs|wooden_stairs|wooden_trapdoors|d=and}} item tags.
* The <code>slabs</code> block and item tags now use the respective <code>wooden_slabs</code> tag.
